intro: Tithymalus gaubae, commonly known as the Gaubae's tithymalus, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its floral structure is adapted for pollination by specific insect species, contributing to its ecological niche. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
